parent.description: Parent issue number to create this issue as a sub-issue of

name: create_agent_task
description: Create a new GitHub Copilot agent task

name: close_discussion
description: Close a GitHub discussion with a comment and optional resolution reason

body.description: Comment body to add when closing the discussion

discussion_number.description: Optional discussion number (uses triggering discussion if not provided)

name: close_issue
description: Close a GitHub issue with a comment

body.description: Comment body to add when closing the issue

issue_number.description: Optional issue number (uses triggering issue if not provided)

name: add_comment
description: Add a comment to a GitHub issue, pull request, or discussion

item_number.description: Issue, pull request or discussion number

name: create_pull_request
description: Create a new GitHub pull request

branch.description: Optional branch name. If not provided, the current branch will be used.

labels.description: Optional labels to add to the PR

name: create_pull_request_review_comment
description: Create a review comment on a GitHub pull request

path.description: File path for the review comment

start_line.description: Optional start line for multi-line comments

side.description: Optional side of the diff: LEFT or RIGHT

name: create_code_scanning_alert
description: Create a code scanning alert. severity MUST be one of 'error', 'warning', 'info', 'note'.

file.description: File path where the issue was found

line.description: Line number where the issue was found

severity.description: Security severity levels follow the industry-standard Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) that is also used for advisories in the GitHub Advisory Database and must be one of "error", "warning", "info", "note".

ruleIdSuffix.description: Optional rule ID suffix for uniqueness

name: add_labels
description: Add labels to a GitHub issue or pull request

item_number.description: Issue or PR number (optional for current context)

name: add_reviewer
description: Add reviewers to a GitHub pull request

reviewers.description: GitHub usernames to add as reviewers

pull_request_number.description: Pull request number (optional - uses triggering PR if not provided)

name: assign_milestone
description: Assign an issue to a milestone

issue_number.description: Issue number to assign milestone to

name: push_to_pull_request_branch
description: Push changes to a pull request branch

branch.description: Optional branch name. Do not provide this parameter if you want to push changes from the current branch. If not provided, the current branch will be used.

pull_request_number.description: Optional pull request number for target '*'

name: upload_asset
description: Publish a file as a URL-addressable asset to an orphaned git branch

path.description: Path to the file to publish as an asset. Must be a file under the current workspace or /tmp directory. By default, images (.png, .jpg, .jpeg) are allowed, but can be configured via workflow settings.

name: update_release
description: Update a GitHub release description. IMPORTANT: You must provide the 'tag' parameter with the release tag name (e.g., 'v1.0.0'). The tag cannot be inferred from event context in all scenarios.

tag.description: Release tag name (REQUIRED - e.g., 'v1.0.0'). This must be provided explicitly.

operation.description: Update operation: 'replace' (full replacement), 'append' (add at end with separator), or 'prepend' (add at start with separator)

body.description: Release body content to set, append, or prepend

name: missing_tool
description: Report a missing tool or functionality needed to complete tasks

tool.description: Name of the missing tool (max 128 characters)

reason.description: Why this tool is needed (max 256 characters)

name: noop
description: Log a message for transparency when no significant actions are needed. Use this to ensure workflows produce human-visible artifacts even when no other actions are taken (e.g., 'Analysis complete - no issues found').
